mdRecord.dcterms:title: Segregated basement ward at UVA Hospital
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: The Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: In 1953, the University of Virginia Hospital was a racially segregated facility. This photograph shows one of the substandard in-patient wards UVA reserved for Black patients in the hospital's basement. UVA first published the photograph in an article titled "The Hospital: Request for State Money and How Alumni Can Help," with the caption, "patients can't feel very well lying under a steam pipe." The article is in the October 1953 edition of the University of Virginia Medical Alumni News Letter.
